alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 3:10PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Larimer. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Automated rainfall gauges indicated up to Up to 0.4 inches of rain have fallen in the past 30 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kinikinik and Rustic. - This includes the following additional locations... Gulches along Highway 14 near and above Rustic, Rising water and large debris in the Poudre River, Pingree Hill and Goodell Corner.
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry gulches is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
